title: Sargent's fantastic flick from all angles!
shortDescription: Norwich's Josh Sargent opened his Premier League account with a sublime flicked finish in their 3-0 win against relegation rivals Watford, but did the American mean it?

title: Ranieri vows to fight on as Watford boss | Carra: I fear for him
shortDescription: Claudio Ranieri has vowed to fight on as Watford manager and has called on his players to change their mentality following their 3-0 home defeat to Norwich.

title: Rangers ease past Stirling Albion in Scottish Cup
shortDescription:
Alex Lowry scored a dream debut goal while James Tavernier scored and missed a
penalty as Rangers swept Stirling Albion 4-0 in the Scottish Cup.

title: Papers: Arsenal to offer Arteta new contract
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Saturday's national newspapers...

title: Rangnick: I did not take Ronaldo sub reaction personally
shortDescription: Manchester United interim manager Ralf Rangnick says he did not take Cristiano Ronaldo's reaction to his substitution against Brentford personally.

title: Sargent at the double as Norwich beat 10-man Watford
shortDescription: Norwich secured back-to-back Premier League wins to ignite their hopes of survival as Josh Sargent scored twice in a fine 3-0 victory over Watford at Vicarage Road.

title: PL Predictions: Big Dunc to get Everton reaction
shortDescription: It's a busy weekend of Premier League football and Jones Knows is here to provide the latest insight, predictions and betting angles on the action.

title: Wolves will 'protect Traore like Spurs protected Kane' - Lage
shortDescription: Talks between Tottenham and Wolves are progressing over a deal for Adama Traore.

title: Man City in talks to sign River Plate striker Alvarez
shortDescription: Manchester City are in talks to sign River Plate striker Julian Alvarez.

title: Vieira explains Crystal Palace transformation
shortDescription: Patrick Vieira speaks in detail to Sky Sports about how he has transformed Crystal Palace's playing style this season.

title: WSL: Can resurgent City handle a new-look Arsenal?
shortDescription: Can a resurgent Man City Women handle a new-look Arsenal Women when the two sides meet in the Women's Super League this weekend, live on Sky Sports?

title: Rudiger: Contract talks ongoing | Family feel great in London
shortDescription: Antonio Rudiger says his "family feel great in London" as the defender continues contract talks with Chelsea, with his current deal expiring this summer.

title: WSL previews: Man Utd Women vs Tottenham Women and more
shortDescription: Team news and stats for the latest round of the WSL, with six games on Sunday, including Man City vs Arsenal live on Sky.

title: Everton vs Aston Villa: Caretaker boss Ferguson promises changes
shortDescription: Team news, stats and prediction ahead of Everton vs Aston Villa in the Premier League on Saturday; kick-off 12.30pm.

title: Postecoglou: No quick Celtic return for Kyogo
shortDescription: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou does not have a timescale for Kyogo Furuhashi's return to action.

title: Arsenal vs Burnley: Partey & Xhaka banned
shortDescription: Team news, stats and prediction ahead of Arsenal vs Burnley in the Premier League on Sunday; kick-off 2pm.

title: Crystal Palace vs Liverpool on Sky: Ayew back for Palace
shortDescription: Team news, stats and prediction ahead of Crystal Palace vs Liverpool in the Premier League on Super Sunday; kick-off 2pm.

title: Barlaser: The 'Geordie Pirlo' pulling the strings for Rotherham
shortDescription: Rotherham's Dan Barlaser on the Millers' historic unbeaten run, his international future and the belief that 90 points is the benchmark for automatic promotion this term.

title: Transfer Talk: Why Lingard deal makes sense for Newcastle
shortDescription: Ed Aarons joined The Transfer Talk podcast to discuss Jesse Lingard's options, with Newcastle interested in signing the forward.

title: Rooney flattered by Everton links - but no approach made
shortDescription: Derby boss Wayne Rooney insists there has been no approach from Everton over their vacant managerial position.
